data.title: Below Expectations
data.text: We were looking for something a little different to eat, and liked the idea of Moroccan (which we had enjoyed before). While the food was flavorful, the portion sizes were quite small for the price, with all of the sides as "add-ons".  Our waiter was attentive, however overly theatrical, which was quite awkward. With all of the other great restaurants in the area, this would not be one I would return to.

data.title: Overpriced,no flavor,Dusty
data.text: We stopped in for a family celebratory dinner. I noticed the ceiling,which has a colorful sheet hanging,is very dusty. We decided to just try anyway. Waiter recommended the authentic tangine do need. We've eaten Moroccan before and enjoyed elsewhere so we were game. My husband ordered the chicken tangled. It had no rice,couscous or veggies. Just one piece with 5 olives and a bit of sauce. I had a lamb tangine. It had veggies but no flavor.  These 2 dishes with a sangria and beer and a small rice was $73. Disappointing meal

data.title: Great Food & Service
data.text: Friendly staff and good food.  Nice atmosphere inside but a little noisy if you eat on the front patio area.

data.title: Amazing place
data.text:
Morocco's restaurant is a splendid take on North African and Middle East cuisine. The place is located on the busy Castro street and is definitely a must visit place.
They have belly dancing on certain days of the week and different live music on other days. The belly dancing was unique experience for me but honestly I felt embarrassed to see a half naked girl dancing in front of me.
The ambience is really beautiful and catchy with lot of murals on the walls, bedouin type ceiling curtain and add belly dancing to it. They play famous Arabic music and adds to the authentic experience.
Items on my order
Spiced coffee, roasted potatoes, veg couscous dish with caramelized onions, deep fried sweet with honey and almond sauce.
Rating
Food 5/5
Ambience 5/5
Service 5/5
Value for money 4/5

data.title: Tasty Moroccon food.
data.text:
I had read about the reviews saying the restaurant is crowded, but to my surprise on a Saturday when I called (no warriors game either!) they told me to just come in!! 

we ordered the vegetarian options and were not disappointed. Being the first time to any Moroccon restaurant, I couldn't compare with others. Wasn't spicy enough.

The Belly dancing was average, food was good.. Service was not that great. with hardly 10 people in the restaurant, we had to wait for the server to come to the table. Morocco's Sangria wine isn't up to the mark. A bit pricy.. Overall not a bad experience.

data.title: Really good food; expensive; reserve in advance
data.text: The restaurant is usually booked, so, don't walk-in. Reserve it in advance. The food is expensive but really good.

data.title: Very tasty and good portions
data.text: Very nice atmosphere.  I first went there with my wife for special occasion. I had the beef tagine.  Tender and moist.  The lentil salad was great.  Be sure to try the desserts and Mint Tea.  Lots of wine to choose from

data.title: Felt like I was really in Morocco!
data.text:
Recently ate here with my association team, one of whom had been to Morocco. The food was delicious,  although a little too spicy for a couple of people. The atmosphere, including the entertainment, was outstanding.  Our service could not have been better. 

The only two negatives were: they ran out of the special mint tea, and parking was a problem, but that's always the case in a downtown area.

data.title: MOUTH-WATERING MOROCCAN DELIGHTS!
data.text: Beautiful ambience, with draping around the restaurant and lovely Moroccan artwork. The restaurant had enough filled tables to feel like an event, but wasn't so crowded that we couldn't be comfortable.  Two of us ordered the beef kebabs, one ordered the shrimp and another the beef tangine.  The tangine was served covered by an earthenware tent.  As an appetizer we had the shrimp pil pil - amazing sauce!  Our beef was tender and the spices were aromatic and beyond delicious.  Usually I have no room for dessert, but we ordered 3 each of the delicious desserts in filo dough!  Just a taste for everyone along with amazing spiced coffee.  This meal left me feeling satisfied not just for what we ate but for the whole experience.

data.title: Birthday
data.text: We came for dinner to celebrate my birthday and hoping see the Bally dance show , we had reservations and he there in time but we lost  the show ,service was no very professional but food taste good.

data.title: $20 6oz lamb tagine, $22 14 oz beef tagine, enough for 2 people for 2 dinners!
data.text:
Here's one time when I wish my wife hadn't gotten a Groupon coupon, despite the food being excellent.  Why? Read on.

The wife had gotten a $20 Groupon coupon for $12 for take out only at the Morocco restaurant on Castro near the corner of El Camino Real.

I called up at 4:05pm the day after New Years and ordered a $20 lamb tagine (stew)  and $22 beef tagine dishes take out, and the server is friendly and clear, and told me to come in 15 minutes.

15 minutes later I'm at the counter, place is empty, credit card out, and the food comes out piping hot in two take out boxes.   Good service, great atmosphere, friendly helpful employees, with white cloth tables, clean colorful carpet, and view of downtown Mountain View through the large windows.    

At home, I cook brown rice and broccoli, and reheat the lamb and beef dishes. 

Some reviews have mentioned the portions being too small.  Well here's one thing we can't do in the restaurant but can do with take out: I weigh the meats, without the sauces, bones, and vegetables.  6 ounces of lamb, and 14 ounces of beef.

The lamb comes with a yellow curry sauce, potatoes, onions, and carrots, and is delicious -so tender it falls off the bone.

The tender, shredded beef comes with apricots and nuts in a very sweet sauce.  My wife's favorite!  BTW the wife doesn't like couscous, which is the standard addition with the meat dishes.    

The wife and I together eat half of each dish, with the other half being dinner two days from now.  So the portion sizes are more than ample, even for $20+ apiece.  

I would have forgone the $8 in Groupon savings to ogle those dancing ladies at the Morocco, starting at 730pm.  But my wife wears the pants in the house, unlike those scantily clad belly dancers!   

And Trump, I would definitely make an exception for any scantily clad Muslim belly dancers trying to enter the country -after all they have no place to hide any weapons. 

This would be the place for a first date or a romantic date, or a date to impress, and definitely not the place for a breakup date -too expensive!

data.title: Quirky and Good!
data.text: The dining experience was enriched by the treatment received from our wait staff - a bit quirky but endearing!

data.title: great lunch spot
data.text: Stopped in for lunch, sat on the huge outside patio, had the lunch special set menu. Great food, prompt service (set menu has a "ten minute guarantee"), friendly attentive staff.

data.title: Consistently good food
data.text:
We went here for a family dinner including young kids and really enjoyed it. The food was consistently tasty: we had the kebabs appetizer (which the kids loved), sardine appetizer (which the kids also loved!), spinach salad (tasty with a little too much dressing), imperial couscous, lamb & vegetable tagine, kefta meatballs and for dessert, the briwatts.  I would recommend any of these dishes.  We opted out of the Family Style Menu because it didn't look like you had a lot of options (i.e., you can only choose 2 entrees for everyone to share). We also enjoyed the belly dancer who made her way around the room (no stage).  The only criticism we had was of the wine service.  We asked for a wine list but they said it was "too extensive" and tried to narrow the options by asking us if we wanted red or white, dry or sweet, heavy or light, etc.  The waiter brought 2 red wines for us to taste - the Moroccan wine was too tart so we went with the California red which was just ok, but I would have preferred to see an entire list and choose.
In any case, the food and service were very good and everyone loved the belly dancer, so we would recommend this restaurant.

data.title: Delicious but a bit pricey
data.text:
This place has really good Moroccan food and ambience. Good place for vegetarians.
Prices are a bit high but it was worth it

data.title: Decent food, strange service experience
data.text: We shared several dishes here the other night: samosa variety, lentil salad, beet and potato salad and the lamb tagine.  We especially liked the salads and the lamb.  The strange thing was the service we received by a young woman.  We wanted wine (apparently NOT a good idea here) and the menu listed something like regular white/red and chef's special white/red.  There was no indication of winery or type of wine, just color.  When we asked she was confused.  I asked if there was a chardonnay and she said yes and she would bring one I had heard of.  That she did but she took it straight out of the cardboard box,opened it and poured -- totally warm white wine.  Didn't seem to get it when we pointed out that it needed to be chilled.  We finally gave up and ordered a pinot noir (had to search for winery name) instead of waiting for the other bottle to chill.  Not bad food, not expensive but if you like to have a nice wine with your dinner this is probably not the place for you!

data.title: Maybe it will be better the second time
data.text: Great Atmosphere but the food is too traditional so not Americanized. Thus an acquired taste. I eat pretty much any nations food but this was just not my cup of tea, kids barely touched their food. Recommend this place mixes their tradition dishes to make them a bit more California style a bit like what Amber does with Indian food.

data.title: Taste of Morocco in Mountain View
data.text: I am a vegetarian and thankfully Moroccan cuisine is right up my alley. I ordered vegetarian Tagine delightfully complemented by mint tea and North African Berber music playing in the background and the combination was an experience I'm unlikely to forget in a hurry.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text:
Tried this one out following a friend's suggestion, and being fond of Moroccan cuisine. Ended up with a totally disappointing experience.
The lamb with cous cous was way too oily (the lamb) and dry (the couscous). It is hard to make both mistakes at the same time...
The chicken tagine was even worse, the chicken being almost burned...
And the service... is it so hard to make sure that the tables in your restaurant are not wobbly?

data.title: Great service, wonderful atmosphere, legit Moroccan!
data.text: I went to Morocco a few years ago and had some of the best food of my life there (for super-cheap).  The fare here is as legit as you can get in the States.  The servings were nice and normal-human-sized (i.e., not American-sized) and the staff was wonderful.  When they learned that my wife and I were celebrating an anniversary, they gave us free champaign.  Plenty of options for vegans too!
